result.execSummary:
The defendant Ward H Keil was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: La Crosse County Clerk of Courts

miscConds.notes:
Pay restitution in an amount to be determined - minimum amount of restitution will be $32,923.  The exact amount will be determined at a Restitution Hearing set in 30 days

Pay 10% restitution surcharge to the DA's office

Restitution will be paid under the terms of a payment plan - Court orders $500 per month - to be enforced through a wage assignment.  The Court will re-examine the payment amount at the Restitution Hearing
.

Obtain and maintain full-time employment unless the defendant becomes disabled
.

No contact with the Onalaska Historical Society, its Board of Directors and members, including the Onalaska Public Library and its building
.

Continue with counseling for gambling

Complete any other counseling or treatment as recommended by the PO

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DoC Supervision fees

The Court may grant an early discharge after 3 years following the completion of the conditions of this Court Order and the restitution is paid in full, adherence to the rules of supervision and upon the recommendation of the PO

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ward H Keil

records.addlTxt:
from onalaska Area Historical Society   re: amount of money rec'd from def in 2016 less than what was ordered - req action be taken
PER EML:  cc DA & DOC/PO

Confidential Judge's Notes from 
Restitution Hearing.

Kisken - Def lost his job - proposal now is for $200.00 month
Skemp - I can't agree to that, non profit organization, some of
the representatives are here today and they are NOT in agreement
with $200.00 month.
COURT: He needs to get a full time job and work for somebody other 
than his self - he has got alot of restitution to pay.
COURT: TEMPORARY REDUCTION IN RESTITUTION PAYMENTS.
$200.00 MONTH, IN JUNE IT GOES BACK UP TO $500.00 MONTH.
Quarterly Taxes should be given to the DA's Office.  If the Board requests,
it can be made available to them.
Any tax returns should be used in full for the restitution.
Def can submit medical appt card and cover letter so Court
can approve 2 day furlough
Attorney Kisken is allowed to w/draw.
DOC-31 filed - signed by EML

DGM for EML
Kisken - issue is Def's ability to pay the restitution.
Skemp - Was not aware EML wasn't going to be here,
he is familiar with the case and set the restitution.  Would
prefer he make the determination about ability to pay.
Court: I agree - hearing will be continued for EML to hear
Reschedule and send notices.
assigned PO Dustin Hines

State by Skemp /  Def w/ Atty Peter Kisken
Stmt of Neg Plea / Plea Quest & Waiver filed
Motion for Consolidation w/ cases 15CF273 & 15CF569 - Order signed by EML
Victim Impact Stmt filed
Ct 1 - Def pleads GUILTY
CRT:  Plea is FV&I made - sufficient factual basis exists - finds def guilty
CRT'S SENTENCE:  Sent w/held;  Probation 5 yrs w/ conditions:  Pay restitution - amt to be det. - minimum amt is $32,923, the exact amt will be determined in Hrg in 30 days;  Pay 10% rest. surcharge to DA;  Make regular monthly paymts toward restitution of $500 - CRT will re-examine pymt amount @ Rest. Hrg;  Obtain & maintain full-time employment unless def becomes disabled;  No Contact w/ Onalaska Historical Society, its Board of Directors & members including Onalaska Library & its building;  Continue w/ counseling for gambling;  Complete any other counseling or treatment as recommended by PO;  Pay CC & DOC fees;  If restitution is paid in full & all other conditions are met, probation can end in 3 yrs
Plea hearing at 08-10-2015 04:00 pm

11:18 am - Def in court w/Atty Peter Brian Kisken.  Jessica Skemp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Prelim waiver filed - signed/understands.  No promises/threats.
COURT finds Waiver FV & I made -  Probable cause found - Bound over for trial.
Information filed - Reading waived.  Def Stands Mute - NG Pleas entered.
PTC:   6/5/15 @ 3:30 (DA)
STC: 7/9/15 @ 10am (EML)

Def will waive PH time limits
